response.message: I'd comment on comparing your toddler to a cat, but as a parent of a four-year-old and 20-month-old, I know the analogy is all too apt.

The real story here is that the cat is a professional, full-time Cat-Fancier software developer.

He really IS working on our problemz!
That is the cutest tech support I've ever seen.

Glad to have helped :-)

By the way, in addition to debugging and walking on the tightrope, Zoe (the cat) also plays basketball

http://cache.gawker.com/assets/images/deadspin/2008/10/zoedunking.JPG

captcha: Provision minivans

Glad to see Henry has foregone the mouse and is awesome enough to just use the keyboard.

Just me, or did someone else pick up on the fact that Zoe chose to play with the "Mouse Pro Deluxe"? Cats and mice eh.

Hey, thanks for stopping by my Oddly Enough blog. I love that cat photo and have used it four or five times in the past couple of years, most recently in my "review" of the iPad the weekend it went on sale.
http://blogs.reuters.com/oddly-enough/2010/04/04/ipad-damn-was-that-this-weekend/

Regards,
Bob Basler
Jeff, you bought the laptop. Have you considered buying the cat? We could use a nice 404 image too.
You can actually buy those in Manila as well as Hong Kong and Singapore right off the shelf.
It is nice to see you've set up second-level tech support. Even nicer that it is a human instead of an automated phone tree.
What is the license on the original and/or your modified version? Can I "Save As" and use it myself?
